frameDefinitions: A Whole separates into Parts, or one part of a whole, called Part_1, becomes separate from the remaining portion, Part_2.
A Recipient starts off without the Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.
These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole_patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole_patient no longer existing as such.
frameExamples: This small channel meanders through marsh and wetland, <t>splitting</t> into several smaller channels that empty into Lake St. Clair.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
<t>After</t> she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk.
He <t>ripped</t> <t>up</t> the letter faster than you can say 'Jack Robbins'. INI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which separates into <fen>Parts</fen>.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned.
Part_2 is the second of two Parts mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes possession.
When the event occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> denotes where the Getting takes place.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
This is the entity which moves under its own power.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.

The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is  being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded.
The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event  with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located.
The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> being broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Agent</fen> and that ends up broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>.
The fragments of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> that result from the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action.
An event which leads to the fragmentation of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks up the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> into pieces.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Metalworkers' union</fex> to split into regional divisions
These daughter chromosomes then begin to separate <fex>from each other</fex>, each moving away from the metaphase plate and toward one of the two spindle pole regions.
Initially, <fex>the front part</fex> separated from the rest of the body.
Initially the front split <fex>from the rest of the body</fex>
However it is believed they separated <fex>at least 2 if not 3 million years ago</fex>.
The two parts likely separated <fex>above the Atlantic</fex>.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
<fex>Hours of eating and drinking</fex> followed the wedding ceremony.
Hours of eating and drinking followed <fex>the wedding ceremony</fex>.
<fex>I and I alone</fex> can shatter the gem and break the curse.
Shattering someone's confidence is a little different than shattering <fex>a dish</fex>.
I smashed the toy boat <fex>to flinders</fex>.
